result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Br. 11

Joint hearing on 22CF861/862. Defendant Demone M Cummins in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty William Leroy Brown appeared for State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting Atty Will Davis appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley in court for Defendant Demone M Cummins. Defendant Amond D. Galtney in court in custody. Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Defendent Amond Galtney. 

Court finds counts 1 and 3, and 2 and 4 to be transactionally related. Parties state no objection, orders counts 1 and 3 to be transactionally related, orders counts 2 and 4 to be transactionally related. Detective N. S. duly sworn and testified. Atty. Davis with direct. Witness identified both Defendants in courtroom. Atty. Hurley with cross. Atty. Cornia with cross. State moves for bindover. Atty. Hurley objects to bindover, waives argument. Atty. Cornia objects to bindover, waives argument. Court notes timely filing of request for substitution, finds PC for BO to branch. Branch to conduct arraignment.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Amond G or any family member of DLC. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
